original: Högberg, Per Ivar, b aningen jör, Göteborg, f. 1/1/91 i Yllestad, Skarab. 1., av Anders Gustaf o. Ida Maria H. G. 17 m. Hedvig Nj^lander. Barn: Inga Maria f. 18, g. m. fil. kand. Gert Vikström, Sten Ivar f. 21, tax:-assist. i Jömiköp., Per Inge f. 3^1, stud. — Stud. v. allm. lärov. 02-08, ex. fr. tekn. lärov. 12. Anst. v. Nordmark-Klarälvens järnv. 13-15, ing. v. Väs-tergötl.-Gbgs järnv. 16, baning. där ’sed. 33, förordn. .som arbetsled. f. större ombyggn. 21-24 o. 30-32. Led. av Ensk. järnv. ing:förb. sed. 28, Tekn. samf. i Gbg sed. 29 m. fl. Resor t. Norge 34 o. 36, Danm. 35, Tyskl., Ös-terr. m. fl. länder 38.
translated: Högberg, Per Ivar, born in Jör, Göteborg, on January 1, 1891, in Yllestad, Skaraborg. First child of Anders Gustaf and Ida Maria H. G. Married to Hedvig Njölander in 1917. Children: Inga Maria born in 1918, married to Philosophy candidate Gert Vikström and Sten Ivar born in 1921, a tax assistant in Jönköping, and Per Inge born in 1931, a student. Studied at a general secondary school from 1902 to 1908 and graduated from a technical school in 1912. Employed at Nordmark-Klarälven's railway from 1913 to 1915, engineer at Västergötland-Göteborg's railway in 1916, and worked there as a trackman from 1933. Appointed as a leader for a major renovation from 1921 to 1924 and from 1930 to 1932. Member of the Private Railway Engineering Association since 1928, the Technical Society in Göteborg since 1929 and other societies. Traveled to Norway in 1934 and 1936, Denmark in 1935, Germany, Austria and other countries in 1938.
